klass.name: Physics for Scientists and Engineers
klass.note: EARLY DROP DEADLINE (END OF 2ND WEEK) APPLIES; Discussion and lab (D/L) sections begin on the first day of instruction. You must attend your D/L sections during the first and second week, or you may be dropped from the course. Enter desired lecture followed by discussion then laboratory sections with the same numbers (i.e., if you enrolled in Dis 101 then you must enroll in Lab 101). The discussion and laboratory sections must correspond with the lecture. MIDTERM EXAMS: Physics 7A lecture 1 midterms will be held on 2/25/08 and 4/7/08. All midterms are from 6:00 to 8:00 p.m. Plan accordingly. DO NOT schedule any conflicts.

klass.note: 1) Enter desired lecture; 2) enter a discussion section associated with your lecture (Lec 1 - pick discussion in the 100's, 2 - 200's); 3) enter a lab section that does not conflict with the lecture. klass.name: Modern Physics and Advanced Electrical Laboratory
klass.note: "Basic Semiconductor Circuits" - Physics 111 lab hours are M 12-4 p.m. and TWTF 1-5 p.m. All sections of Physics 111 meet the first day of class at 1 p.m. in 251 LeConte Hall. First time students: enroll in BSC--section 1. You must attend the weekly BSC lecture, and have at least two free afternoons each week to spend in lab. Second semester students: enroll in Advanced Lab--section 2. You must have a least four free afternoons each week to spend in lab. Third semester students (optional): additional experiments may be completed by enrolling in section 3. See lab staff for details. ($100 Course Materials Fee - subject to change)

klass.name: Modern Physics and Advanced Electrical Laboratory
Modern Physics and Advanced Electrical Laboratory
klass.note: "Advanced Lab" - Physics 111 lab hours are M 12-4 p.m. and TWTF 1-5 p.m. All sections of Physics 111 meet the first day of class at 1 p.m. in 251 LeConte Hall. First time students: enroll in BSC--section 1. You must attend the weekly BSC lecture, and have at least two free afternoons each week to spend in lab. Second semester students: enroll in Advanced Lab--section 2. You must have a least four free afternoons each week to spend in lab. Third semester students (optional): additional experiments may be completed by enrolling in section 3. See lab staff for details. ($100 Course Materials Fee - subject to change) Also: KOLOMENSKY, Y
